title: Plate
text: This early plate, along with the <I>Bird Vase<I> at left, shows how Voulkos brought Abstract Expressionism and ceramics together, revolutionizing the medium. Here Voulkos uses the thick, squarish plate form as a canvas, freely applying vivid glazes and epoxy paints in the manner of Abstract Expressionist artists Jackson Pollock and Franz Kline.
description: stoneware with low-fire glaze and acrylic paint; on mount
creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund and Gift of funds from Tod and Ruth Braunstein
